summary: Item sorting with the addition of crafting, potions, ingredients, quest items, books and scrolls with no weight.
descriptionHtml:
[b]Item Sorting with Weightless Items[/b]
by saige

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]What this Mod does[/b]

This mod basically combines my version of an Item Sorting mod plus a Weightless item mod into one ESP file. My load order was getting larger as new mods are released so I really needed to cut down some ESP files. With the release of the CK, I decided to make one for myself that suited my tastes and released it for anybody else that might be interested.

Currently this mod works as follows;

Potions and poisons have been renamed to be grouped together so that they\'re easier to find. Player made potions should match their loot/bought versions. Such as Potion of Healing. All potions including player made now weight 0. Also note that special potions/beverages still retain their original name. Here\'s an example of their sorting:

Esbern\'s Potion
Fortify: Sneak II
Fortify: Magicka Regen IV
Potion of Invisibility III
Potion of Healing
Potion of Healing I
Potion of Healing IV
Poison: Weak to Fire III
Poison: Stamina Damage V
Resist: Frost [Ice Wraith Essence]
Resist: Shock IV

All Soul gems now weight 0 and have been renamed per the following:

Soul Gem Azura: Azura\'s Star
Soul Gem Azura: The Black Star
Soul Gem I: Petty
Soul Gem II: Lesser
Soul Gem III: Common
Soul Gem IV: Greater
Soul Gem V: Grand
Soul Gem VI: Black

Most Smithing items now weight 0 (this also includes Dragon Bones, Firewood, Leather and scraps) and have been labeld per the following:

Ore: \"Type\"
Ingot: \"Type\"
Gem: \"Type\"
Hide: \"Type\" (This includes pelts and other hides such as Dragon Scales and Chaurus Chitin)
Smelt: \"Type\" (For the Dwemer items that are smeltable. These items are a quarter of their original weight. ie Weighed 20, now 5)

All Miscellaneous Quest items now weight 0 and use the \"Quest:\" Label. This will also make them easier to spot. Please note that quest weapons and apparel are not included so they have no change to either name or weight. Also note that some radial miscellaneous quest items are done at random and may not have a quest label (such as the bard instrument quests). Unique items will instead use a \"Unique:\" label and also weight 0. Here\'s an example of their sorting:

Pantea\'s Flute
Quest: Curious SIlver Mold
Quest: Diamond Claw
Quest: Fragment of Wuuthrad
Unique: Moth in a Jar
Unique: The Dancer\'s Flute

All miscellaneous and other clutter items will just use the \"Misc:\" label. For the large part their weight has not been touched. However some clutter items that are used by other crafting/armor mods (such as Charcoal) have had their weight made to 0 but they will still be labeled with \"Misc:\". For example:

Misc: Charcoal
Misc: Dwemer Pan
Misc: Fork
Misc: Lockpick
Misc: Plate

All books, notes and letters have had their weight changed to 0. For the large part their names remain unchanged with the exception of skill books, so they\'re easier to find, and spell tomes. Here\'s an example for how they appear:

Racial Phylogeny [Restoration]
Spell Tome [Alt I]: Candlelight
Spell Tome [Dest II]: Lightning Rune
Spell Tome [Rest II]: Fast Healing
The Black Arrow, v2 [Archery]

All food has a weight of 0 and has been relabeled to either have \"Beverage:\", \"Cheese:\", \"Cooked:\", \"Fruit:\", \"Raw:\", \"Sweet:\" or \"Veg:\". For example:

Beverage: Alto Wine
Cheese: Mammoth Bowl
Cooked: Salmon Steak
Fruit: Green Apple
Raw: Pheasant Breast
Sweet: Sweet Roll
Veg: Leek

Arrows have had no weight change but have been relabeled to:

Arrow: \"Type\"

Finally, while no change has been made to their names, Scrolls and Alchemy Ingredients all weight 0.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Installation[/b]

Very easy, either use NMM to download and activate the plugin. Otherwise drop directly into

C:\\Program Files (x86)\\steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\\Data 

and activate the plugin via the Skyrim Launcher under Data Files.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Mod Load Order[/b]

The ESP file can go anywhere.

However make sure that if you\'re using any other mods that also modify the stats for items that they go after in the load order so their changes work. Don\'t forget to use a bashed patch if necessary. For example:

Skyrim.esm
<------- 
<------- other esp files
<------- 
Item Sorting with Weightless items.esp
Soul Gems Differ.esp
<------- 
<------- other esp files
<------- 
Bashed Patch.esp

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Compatibility[/b]

This mod works fine with SkyUI, Categorized Favorites Menu and Crafting Mods.

This mod will not work with any other mods that modify the same items such as other sorting or weight mods. However you can put a mod that changes an item (such as soul gems) below in the load order and it should take that mods changes but you will lose the name sorting and the weight changes from that item. Otherwise I highly recommend you do a bash patch to get everything working smoothly.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Known Issues[/b]

Hopefully there isn\'t any, but if there are any mistakes or problems feel free to post and I\'ll fix it as soon as I can. Suggestions also welcome.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Credits[/b]

While I made this from scratch I like to thank;

HeadBomb for the first item sorting mod
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=2730

Valdacil for his sorting mod
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=4873

And finally Wolferoo for his weightless mod
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=1622

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Permissions[/b]

I don\'t mind what you do to the ESP file as long as you give me credit and link back to this page if it still exists.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Version History[/b]

1.00 
Initial Release
